page.title: 05THE SCHOOL FETE
page.content:
Some children brought frisbees to the school Fete.It was Rebecca Burchell's and Emma Dobson's birthdays on the same day. Some children brought umbrellas because it was raining.
P.C. Kitchen,Lydeard St. Lawrence's rural area police constable was there supervising the fire engine.
There was a big flop, a car boot sale and a children's stall selling pomanders, cocunut ice, cakes and other things.
Also at the fete we had plate gardens and a competition to see who could guess the name of a goat. The name was "Just William." There were cream teas, hotdogs, icecreams, cake stalls, plant stalls and a wool stall. There were tractor rides too.
